intro: Vittadinia macra, commonly known as the tall sandbur, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are yellow with a prominent central disk. Vittadinia macra is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
